summary: This bill, the Addressing Hostile and Antisemitic Conduct by the Republic of South Africa Act of 2025, addresses concerns about South Africa's actions against Israel and Jewish communities. It calls for suspending direct assistance to South Africa unless it ceases targeting Israel, addresses corruption, and engages constructively with the US. It also mandates targeted sanctions against South African officials involved in antisemitism or corruption and requires reports on South Africa's actions and US aid. The provisions will terminate when the South African government meets specific conditions. The bill aims to hold South Africa accountable for its actions.
